text.tspan: Total shortfall from extreme poverty (after vs. before tax), 1963 to 2024
This is the amount of money that would be theoretically needed to lift the incomes of all people in extreme

poverty up to the
International Poverty Line
of $3 per day. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in

Note: This data is expressed in
international-$
at 2021 prices. This shortfall does not take into account costs and inefficiencies from making the
